t: “What*pn a help you are to the weak! How*ln you have saved the arm without strength!
What*ln counsel you have given to one*i without wisdom! What*ln helpful insight you have abundantly provided!
To*ln whom have you uttered words? And*ln whose spirit was expressed through you?
“The*pn departed spirits tremble Under*ln the waters and their inhabitants.
Naked*ln is Sheol before Him, And*ln Abaddon has no covering.
He*ln stretches out the north over empty space And*ln hangs the earth on nothing.
He*ln wraps up the waters in His clouds, And*ln the cloud does not burst under them.
He*ln obscures the face of the full moon And*ln spreads His cloud over it.
He*ln has inscribed a circle on the surface of the waters At*ln the boundary of light and darkness.
The*ln pillars of heaven tremble And*ln are amazed at His rebuke.
He*ln quieted the sea with His power, And*ln by His understanding He shattered Rahab.
By*ln His breath the heavens are cleared; His*ln hand has pierced the fleeing serpent.
Behold,*ln these are the fringes of His ways; And*ln how faint a word we hear of Him! But*ln His mighty thunder, who can understand?”
